verses.kjv: But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.
verses.web: But I determined this for myself, that I would not come to you again in sorrow.
verses.ct: I made up my mind that I wouldn't visit you again if it meant bringing more pain.

verses.kjv: For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?
verses.web: For if I make you grieve, then who will make me glad but he who is made to grieve by me?
verses.ct: After all, if I cause you grief, who's left to bring me joy? Only the very people I've hurt.

verses.kjv: And I wrote this same unto you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of you all.
verses.web: And I wrote this very thing to you, so that, when I came, I wouldn’t have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy would be shared by all of you.
verses.ct: That's exactly why I wrote to you instead — so that when I did come, I wouldn't be heartbroken by the people who should be giving me joy. I'm confident that all of you feel the same way: when I'm happy, you're happy too.

verses.kjv: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly unto you.
verses.web: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears, not that you should be made to grieve, but that you might know the love that I have so abundantly for you.
verses.ct: I wrote that letter through deep distress and a heavy heart, with tears streaming down my face. My goal wasn't to hurt you — it was to show you just how much I love you.

verses.kjv: But if any have caused grief, he hath not grieved me, but in part: that I may not overcharge you all.
verses.web: But if any has caused sorrow, he has caused sorrow, not to me, but in part (that I not press too heavily) to you all.
verses.ct: Now, if someone among you caused pain, he didn't just hurt me — he hurt all of you to some degree. I say "to some degree" because I don't want to be too harsh about it.

verses.kjv: Sufficient to such a man is this punishment, which was inflicted of many.
verses.web: This punishment which was inflicted by the many is sufficient for such a one;
verses.ct: The punishment the majority of you imposed on this person has been enough.

verses.kjv: So that contrariwise ye ought rather to forgive him, and comfort him, lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow.
verses.web: so that on the contrary you should rather forgive him and comfort him, lest by any means such a one should be swallowed up with his excessive sorrow.
verses.ct: So now it's time to do the opposite — forgive him and encourage him. Otherwise, he could be crushed by too much grief.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirm your love toward him.
verses.web: Therefore I beg you to confirm your love toward him.
verses.ct: I'm urging you: show him that your love for him is real.

verses.kjv: For to this end also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye be obedient in all things.
verses.web: For to this end I also wrote, that I might know the proof of you, whether you are obedient in all things.
verses.ct: This was actually one of the reasons I wrote — to test you and see whether you'd follow through and be obedient in every way.

verses.kjv: To whom ye forgive any thing, I forgive also: for if I forgave any thing, to whom I forgave it, for your sakes forgave I it in the person of Christ;
verses.web: Now I also forgive whomever you forgive anything. For if indeed I have forgiven anything, I have forgiven that one for your sakes in the presence of Christ,
verses.ct: When you forgive someone, I forgive them too. And whatever I've forgiven — if there was anything to forgive — I did it for your sake, in the presence of Christ.

verses.kjv: Lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.
verses.web: that no advantage may be gained over us by Satan, for we are not ignorant of his schemes.
verses.ct: We can't let Satan outmaneuver us. We know exactly how he operates.

verses.kjv: Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach Christ’s gospel, and a door was opened unto me of the Lord,
verses.web: Now when I came to Troas for the Good News of Christ, and when a door was opened to me in the Lord,
verses.ct: When I arrived in Troas to preach the good news about Christ, the Lord opened a door of opportunity for me there.

verses.kjv: I had no rest in my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them, I went from thence into Macedonia.
verses.web: I had no relief for my spirit, because I didn’t find Titus, my brother, but taking my leave of them, I went out into Macedonia.
verses.ct: But my spirit couldn't find rest because my brother Titus wasn't there. So I said goodbye to the believers and headed on to Macedonia.

verses.kjv: Now thanks be unto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.
verses.web: Now thanks be to God, who always leads us in triumph in Christ, and reveals through us the sweet aroma of his knowledge in every place.
verses.ct: But thank God! He always leads us in triumphant procession through Christ, and through us he spreads the fragrance of knowing him everywhere we go.

verses.kjv: For we are unto God a sweet savour of Christ, in them that are saved, and in them that perish:
verses.web: For we are a sweet aroma of Christ to God, in those who are saved and in those who perish:
verses.ct: To God, we are the sweet aroma of Christ — both among those who are being saved and among those who are perishing.

verses.kjv: To the one we are the savour of death unto death; and to the other the savour of life unto life. And who is sufficient for these things?
verses.web: to the one a stench from death to death, to the other a sweet aroma from life to life. Who is sufficient for these things?
verses.ct: To those who are perishing, we smell like death leading to death. But to those being saved, we are the fragrance of life leading to life. And who is up to a task like that?

verses.kjv: For we are not as many, which corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God speak we in Christ.
verses.web: For we are not as so many, peddling the word of God. But as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God, we speak in Christ.
verses.ct: Unlike so many others, we don't peddle God's word for profit. Instead, we speak in Christ with complete sincerity — as people sent by God, standing in his presence.
